alert.note: Alert for Greater Lake Tahoe Area (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: High Wind Warning issued January 03 at 11:27AM PST until January 04 at 7:00AM PST by NWS Reno
info.description: ...HIGH WIND WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...Southwest winds 20 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph expected. Sierra ridge gusts over 100 mph. Sheltered areas may only see gusts 25 to 35 mph. Wave heights on Lake Tahoe of 3 to 5 feet, possibly up to 6 feet at times tonight. * WHERE...Greater Lake Tahoe Area. * WHEN...Until 7 AM PST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Damaging winds could blow down trees and power lines. Power outages are possible. Dangerous conditions for recreational activities on Lake Tahoe and throughout the backcountry. Very rough air for aviation interests. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Snow is expected later this afternoon through midday Tuesday. West of Highway 89, 3 to 8 inches of snow is possible. East of Highway 89, a dusting up to 2 inches of snow is possible. Blowing snow may reduce visibilities.
info.instruction: Now is the time to secure loose outdoor items such as patio furniture, holiday decorations, and trash cans before winds increase which could blow these items away. Prepare ahead of time by making sure you have extra food and water on hand, flashlights with spare batteries and/or candles, and charge your mobile devices in the event of a power outage. Check CALTRANS and/or NDOT for any travel restrictions due to snow or wind before venturing out.
